name: CreateClickupList
description:
Create a new list in a ClickUp folder.

Use this tool to add a new list to a specified folder in ClickUp. Ideal for organizing tasks or projects within a folder.

parameters.name: folder_id
parameters.description: The unique integer identifier for the folder where the new list will be added.

parameters.name: list_name
parameters.description: The name of the new list to be created within the specified ClickUp folder.

parameters.name: list_description
parameters.description: A plain text description for the list. Use this to provide details about the list's purpose.

parameters.name: formatted_list_description
parameters.description: Provide a markdown-formatted description for the List. Use this instead of plain text content.

value_schema.description: Use `markdown_content` instead of `content` to format your List description.

parameters.name: due_date_timestamp
parameters.description: The due date for the list in Unix timestamp format. Determines when the list should be completed.

parameters.name: list_priority
parameters.description: An integer value indicating the priority of the list, where a higher number typically means higher priority.

parameters.name: list_assignee_user_id
parameters.description: The user ID to assign this list to a specific user. This identifies who will be responsible for the list.

value_schema.description: Include a `user_id` to assign this List.

parameters.name: list_color
parameters.description: Specifies the color of the List, not related to task statuses.

value_schema.description: **Status** refers to the List color rather than the task Statuses available in the List.

parameters.name: include_time_in_due_date
parameters.description: Set to true to include a specific time with the due date.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the clickup API.

parameters.name: markdown_content
parameters.description: Use `markdown_content` instead of `content` to format your List description.

value_schema.description: Use `markdown_content` instead of `content` to format your List description.

parameters.name: assignee
parameters.description: Include a `user_id` to assign this List.

value_schema.description: Include a `user_id` to assign this List.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: **Status** refers to the List color rather than the task Statuses available in the List.

value_schema.description: **Status** refers to the List color rather than the task Statuses available in the List.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
